availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Mangan (Richmond, Cass County, Illinois, soldier - 1st Lt. 11th Ky. Cav)

body.p: Cass County, Illinois, tailor and soldier. Kentucky native Married to Elizabeth Mangan. Father of Robert Mangan, Jane Mangan, James Mangan, Anne Mangan, Charles Mangan, and Edward Mangan. Tailor in Cass County, Illinois, in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain from September 9, 1861 to January 27, 1863. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as s first lieutenant and captain from November 26, 1863 to March 18, 1864. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as s first lieutenant and captain from March 18, 1864 to August 23, 1865.
